Olympic Games is a seminar for and of athletes. While open to the student body at-large, the class draws heavily from Yale's student athlete population. The questions posed in the seminar, however, extend beyond the realm of athletics. You discuss everything from race to commercialization to nationalism, and have the opportunity to explore more deeply topics that genuinely pique your interests. Prof. Syrimis stokes the conversation, but the quality of the class ultimately comes down to the level of participation of your fellow classmates - with active and engaged classmates, the seminar is quite enjoyable.

As a student-athlete who deeply cares about the main topics of this course (the role and perception of "the athlete" in society, the Olympics), I would highly recommend this class. In fact, I have already suggested it to several friends.
Yes it was very interesting!
